problem.title: What Is Calendar Risk?
problem.subtitle: Calendar risk is the FX uncertainty between signing a contract and getting paid. Without hedging, your KRW outcome is unpredictable.

example.title: Real Example: Korean Exporter
example.scenario: Your client agrees to pay USD 100,000 in 3 months. Settlement is uncertain.
example.solution: Forward hedge locks in ₩1,305/USD = fixed ₩130.5M regardless of spot movement.

theoreticalPrice.title: How the Price Works (Theoretical Price)
theoreticalPrice.subtitle: We publish a transparent, non-binding 'theoretical' USD↔KRW forward curve daily.

formula.title: Pricing Formula
formula.equation: F = S × (1 + r_USD × t) / (1 + r_KRW × t) + basis + opsCost
formula.explanation: Where F = forward rate, S = spot, r = interest rates, t = time in years, basis = market adjustment, opsCost = operational cost

howItWorks.title: Broker-First Workflow
howItWorks.subtitle: Six steps from theoretical price to settled trade with full audit trail

steps.title: 1. Review Theoretical Price
steps.description: Client logs in and reviews our daily theoretical USD↔KRW forward curve (non-binding, SEAL-logged).

steps.title: 2. Request Firm Quotes
steps.description: Client clicks 'Get firm quotes.' SEAL signs and logs the request with timestamp and policy check.

steps.title: 3. Banks Return Quotes
steps.description: Licensed banks/securities return firm, executable quotes. All responses logged in SEAL audit trail.

steps.title: 4. Dual Approval
steps.description: Client selects best quote. SEAL enforces dual/multi-approval per policy (no money moves without two humans).

steps.title: 5. Route to Bank
steps.description: After SEAL green-light, order routed to chosen bank. Custody only releases funds post-approval.

steps.title: 6. Settle & Audit Pack
steps.description: Trade settles via bank rails or on-chain. Monthly audit pack (PDF/CSV) generated with full forensic trail.
